New Records: Mike Yastrzemski hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning, breaking a tie and securing the Giants' win.
Willy Adames hit a 435-foot homer, the longest by a Brewer this season.
Logan Webb had not allowed a homer in his last 43 1/3 innings before the game.
Key Match Events: The Giants trailed 4-3 before Chapman's solo shot in the fourth inning.
Yastrzemski's two-run homer in the seventh inning put the Giants ahead for good.
Adames' two-run homer in the sixth inning tied the game at 4-4.
The Brewers loaded the bases in the sixth inning but failed to score, missing a key opportunity.
Milwaukee had two men on in the seventh inning, but McCray caught a long fly from Rhys Hoskins at the center-field warning track to end the rally.
Pre-Game Insights: The Giants were playing their fourth straight one-run game and aimed to secure a wild-card spot.
Grant McCray and Matt Chapman were highlighted as key players contributing to the win.
Bob Melvin noted the Brewers' strong bullpen and the challenge of scoring early against them.
Post-Match Reflections: Bob Melvin praised the Giants' ability to handle the Brewers' bullpen but acknowledged the difficulty of the game.
No major announcements or reflections were made post-game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Giants' fourth straight one-run game, going 2-2 during that stretch.
Chourio's 449-foot homer was the longest by any Brewer this season and tied only a few others in MLB history since 2015.
Ryan Walker earned his fourth save in eight opportunities, securing the win for the Giants.
Others: Christian Yelich spoke to reporters about his recovery from season-ending back surgery, expressing optimism about his future.
